content:
Here are some practical steps you can take to move forward and manage your feelings in this situation:

1. Focus on your own self-care: Make sure you're taking care of your physical, emotional, and mental health. This can include things like getting enough sleep, exercise, eating well, and engaging in activities that bring you joy and relaxation.
2. Seek support from other friends: Reach out to other friends in your circle who you feel comfortable talking to and spending time with. You don't have to go through this alone.
3. Set boundaries: If seeing Jess or interacting with her in certain situations is causing you emotional distress, it's okay to set boundaries for yourself. This might mean avoiding certain social events or not engaging in conversations with her that feel uncomfortable.
4. Practice mindfulness: When you start to feel upset or anxious about the situation, try practicing mindfulness techniques like deep breathing or meditation to help calm your mind and regulate your emotions.
5. Consider therapy: If you're really struggling to manage your emotions and move forward, consider seeking support from a therapist who can help you process your feelings and develop coping strategies.
